comments:
Eclipse 3.3M6, CDT HEAD, freshly created "other toolchain" project:

After few Eclipse restarts and editing project properties a few times I started getting IllegalArgumentException at Eclipse startup:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: P/myproject
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:122)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.push(ThreadJob.java:232)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:80)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:226)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.java:117)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.prepareOperation(Workspace.java:1744)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal(Resource.java:1416)
at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.PDOMManager$2.syncronizeProjectSettings(PDOMManager.java:538)
at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.PDOMManager$2.run(PDOMManager.java:526)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
What kind of team-provider (CVS, ..) are you using?

In case your team-provider does not properly implement a rule-factory for operations on the resources the most pessimistic rule (workspace) is used, which causes the problem.
I have fixed the CDT code to work in such situations, you should probably update you team-provider plugin.
Unfortunately I'm using crappy p4wsad plugin from Perforce. Thanks for working around their issue.

traces.message: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: P/myproject
